tatami.core.agent.visualization

Interface AgentGui

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ChatAgentGui, DemoAgentOutputGUI, DemoAgentOutputInputGUI, DemoChairGUI, DemoMainOutputGUI, EmissaryAgentGui, GroupCoordonatorAgentGui, GroupCoordonatorAgentGui2, PCDefaultAgentGui, PCSimulationGui, PCVisualizationGui, PDAAgentGui, TestGui

    public interface AgentGui
    This class models the GUI of an agent (and a GUI in general) so as to make it platform-independent.

    It models the GUI as a set of components that can perform input and/or output. Components are logical units that can contain one or more controls and that can correspond to non-disjoint sets of controls.

    There are three types of functionalities that can be associated to a component:

    • output -- the component is able to change appearance according to set of Object instances;
    • 'passive' input -- the component is able to store information entered by the user (or collected from the user), that can be retrieved as a set of Object instances.
    • 'active' input -- the component is able to notify an AgentGui.InputListener instance about the user's activity, also transmitting a set of Object instances along with the notification.
    Basic examples of the functionalities are as follows: output in a text field; get passive input from a text field; receive active input / notifications when a button is pressed.

    Components in the GUI are identified by String names. It is strongly recommended that the names are stored as constants in enumerations. For instance, default components exists in a GUI, which get their names from the AgentGui.DefaultComponent enumeration.

    Author:
    Andrei Olaru

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  AgentGui.AgentGuiBackgroundTask
      The interface enables the GUI to perform long / background tasks.
      static class  AgentGui.DefaultComponent
      Default components of a GUI.
      static interface  AgentGui.InputListener
      This interface should be implemented by classes that are able to receive notifications from 'active' inputs.
      static interface  AgentGui.ResultNotificationListener
      The interface functions together with AgentGui.AgentGuiBackgroundTask to receive the result of the task performed in background.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void background(AgentGui.AgentGuiBackgroundTask agentGuiBackgroundTask, java.lang.Object argument, AgentGui.ResultNotificationListener resultListener)
      The method executes a task in the background of the GUI, as specified by the implementation.
      void close()
      Instructs the GUI to unload, effectively closing the GUI.
      void connectInput(java.lang.String componentName, AgentGui.InputListener listener)
      Connects a component, as active input, to an implementation of AgentGui.InputListener.
      void doOutput(java.lang.String componentName, java.util.Vector<java.lang.Object> arguments)
      Sends information to a component meant to convey that information to the GUI.
      java.util.Vector<java.lang.Object> getinput(java.lang.String componentName)
      Retrieves information from a component.

    • Method Detail

      • doOutput

        void doOutput(java.lang.String componentName,
            java.util.Vector<java.lang.Object> arguments)
        Sends information to a component meant to convey that information to the GUI.
        Parameters:
        componentName - - the name of the component.
        arguments - - the information to transmit.

      • getinput

        java.util.Vector<java.lang.Object> getinput(java.lang.String componentName)
        Retrieves information from a component. The information is expected to come from the GUI.
        Parameters:
        componentName - - the name of the component.
        Returns:
        the received information.

      • connectInput

        void connectInput(java.lang.String componentName,
                AgentGui.InputListener listener)
        Connects a component, as active input, to an implementation of AgentGui.InputListener. The input will invoke the receiveInput() method of the implementation whenever it is the case.
        Parameters:
        componentName - - the name of the component
        listener - - the AgentGui.InputListener implementation to be invoked on activation.

      • close

        void close()
        Instructs the GUI to unload, effectively closing the GUI.

      • background

        void background(AgentGui.AgentGuiBackgroundTask agentGuiBackgroundTask,
              java.lang.Object argument,
              AgentGui.ResultNotificationListener resultListener)
        The method executes a task in the background of the GUI, as specified by the implementation. This is useful, for instance, for taking tasks off the Swing EDT.(DemointeractivGUI.setTitle(getAgentName());

        Implementations are expected to start another thread for executing the work.

        Parameters:
        agentGuiBackgroundTask - - the task to perform.
        argument - - the argument to pass to the task.
        resultListener - - listener for the result of the task.
        See Also:
        AgentGui.AgentGuiBackgroundTask
